title: Stainless
content:
The Font Bureau face [Stainless](http://web.archive.org/web/20091204155407/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Stainless) is pretty nice. My only gripe is that it has no italic that I can tell. Do any of you guys know of any fonts that are a similar design and have an italic?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20091204155407im_/http:/typophile.com/files/stainless_3465.gif)
author: BradB

comments.content: Might be worth contacting Font Bureau to see if an italic is available. I was able to license the italics for Benton Sans before they were displayed on the FB web site.
Also, I can recommend Klavika from firsthand experience.

Stainless is one of those “square sans” faces that crop up in discussions often. I know that whenever they do, people always tout [Klavika](http://web.archive.org/web/20091204155407/http:/processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/klavika/index.html) as their favorite.

EDIT: There are a bunch more in [this thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20091204155407/http:/www.typophile.com/node/28458). I did some searching for you, and all the types mentioned except for Cachet have italics.

EDIT 2: Oops, sent down to the bottom.

Sophisto is also an alternative, with a wide range of weights including dingbats and patterns as well. MAybe too characteristic?
